etymology.description: 禾 “grain” + 刀 “knife” — to reap grain with a knife.
etymology.interpretation: A knife cutting grain evokes the act of harvesting. From effective cutting comes the sense of sharpness, and by extension, successful reaping leads to ideas of benefit and profit.

examples.chinese: 这把刀很利(這把刀很利)。
这项政策对小企业很有利(這項政策對小企業很有利)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè xiàng zhèngcè duì xiǎo qǐyè hěn yǒulì.
examples.english: This policy is very beneficial to small businesses.

examples.chinese: 他从投资中获利(他從投資中獲利)。
